Something for everyone. Huge desert selectionMirador Buffet at CasinoWe ate breakfast here. Huge variety. All breads, fresh fruit, yoghurt, freshly made juices, make your own omlettes, French toast, pancakes, scrambled egg, bacon, hard boiled eggs, fried banana, authentic island food, cheese and lunch meats. I saw one fruit fly in the food the whole time I was there. But the buffets are virtually outside, so who cares? You鈥檙e eating in the most beautiful environment. I don鈥檛 know about you, but when my mom had a bbq as a child, I saw the occasional fly in HER food too. The staff was CONSTANTLY cleaning the entire buffet/meal areas as well as raking the beach, sweeping beach sand. It was impeccably clean and looked-after. Remember where you鈥檙e going, use caution when wanting to eat fish which has been sitting at the buffet for four hours and eat the occasional pizza when you're hungry, and you鈥檒l be fine. We NEVER so much as even got diarrhea, NOTHING. We were fine and I HAVE a weak stomachHaving said all this, bottled water is available every two feet and the service was often quite excellent. We had some waitors who gave us better service than I鈥檇 had in America. These people are working 15 hour shifts and they are working hard to please you. Tips go a long way if you tip immediately and they will come back with even more better service. Again, this is just common sense. Why tip a waiter or maid at the end of your meal or stay, when you can tip then WELL at the start, and of course they鈥檒l look-after you better then! TAXIWe got a taxi at the airport for $20 to the hotel鈥檚 front door. We got swamped at the airport by scammers, but you have to be smart and ignore them and go straight to the taxis for the best price, which would be $20. We go the same price going back too. LANGUAGE/SERVICEAs soon as we got in our room, we tipped the bellboy and explained to him we needed more drinks and towels. Between broken Spanish and some pointing, he worked it out and we were immediately satisfied. If you can鈥檛 learn Spanish even enough to ask for your drinks or to ask if they speak English, AND you plan on complaining if they cant understand you, then DON鈥橳 GO!! This is their country, you should expect to speak their language a little bit. I speak no Spanish, but with the help of this book:, I was fine. They are patient and if you simply say 鈥渦n memento鈥?they will wait for you to figure out what you are trying to say. They do NOT walk away from you at all. They smile and giggle when you attempt, they appreciate that. I saw so many ignorant Canadians I鈥檓 disappointed to say, asking for their drinks in plain English, not even saying thank you in Spanish, and of course they didn鈥檛 get many smiles in return. But the staff is NOT rude, they are simply don鈥檛 understand English for the most part and are working their butts off ALL day for practically no money in return. Again, if you tip, you get better service. BTW, staff at front desks etc can speak English fine.When we first got to resort, we hopped on the tram which takes you around to each hotel so you get your bearings straight away. That was helpful. If you stay at the casino, it鈥檚 a measly five minute walk to the beach, no big deal! All hotels are really really close to each other. If you walk down the beach past the Palace Hotel, you will cross over out of the resort, and find the markets will you find cheaper deals on massages, trinkets etc which are more expensive at the resorts of course.This time of year was excellent, NOT busy. We have no complaints at all! For what we paid, it was the cheapest, most enjoyable vacation. Its not the Ritz. But we knew that, as we booked a room at the Casino Resort in Dominican Republic, not the Ritz in New York. The weather was unbelievably gorgeous, the beach is stunning. I have lived in Australia and around the world for years, and this IS one of the best beaches I have ever seen. There is NO seaweed on the beach for those ignorant enough to think so, the palm trees simply shed and they rake that each morning. Its an excellent vacation, in a very inexpensive way, just keep in mind where you are, how much you鈥檙e paying, and what you鈥檙e there for. If you want to speak English, have five star ROOMS and eat ONLY American food, go to Hawaii!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Beautiful Place...Awful Resort If you want a beautiful beach and a clean room you've picked the right place. That's about all it has to offer. The staff isn't friendly. The buffet restaurant had crows, flies and cats in the food. If you survive on pizza (and it's good and it doesn't make you sick) you'll probably be fine. If you decide to be brave and eat poorly refrigerated meat, you'll be spending a lot of your vacation time in the washroom. The piano bar at the casino makes great drinks and provides a fun atmoshphere (thanks to the tourists and the pianist, not the staff). Strong advice if you go...you can't avoid eating for seven days so you'll have to eat the food sometime. Bring a lot of Imodium. Also there is a pharmacy that I found out about on one of my last days there which carries something stronger and more effective. Because I couldn't get out of the washroom for much of my trip, I didn't get this advice until too late. I wouldn't recommend this resort despite it's beautiful surroundings simply because I didn't talk to many tourists who didn't spend at least a couple of days sick. Unfortunately, if you go with a partner like I did, you may not both get sick at the same time and the entire vacation is ruined. I was sick the second, third and fourth day after eating salmon from the made to order pasta bar (it tasted okay at the time). He was sick on the fourth fifth and sixth day. This was the case with many, many tourists.
Reviews.Author: Frank560

Reviews.Content: Amazing value and experience I booked my trip online with sunwing, which cost me $860 CDN all inclusive for a week. I was concerned after reading all the negative reviews but after arriving at this beautiful resort, having my first meal and unpacking into a clean well maintained room with electronic safe I knew I had little to worry about. No hot water or electricity problems, I found the staff to be courteous and attentive, the meals were great and more variety than I expected. Casino was more than the small room described by other reviewers, the same ones that somehow missed the front desk (it's the big one you see when you first enter either hotel, you know, the one with staff behind it) The beach was amazing and the two tours I ended up taking that came strongly recommended by my tour guide (who did an amazing job) which were 4 wheeling and Marinarium whihch is snorkling along the coral reef and swimming with sharks were incredible and well worth the ~ $80 US each. I believe that a lot of peoples frustrations came from travelling with the masses in peak season and I'm sure with their non stop complaints the staff were likely frustrated as well, but as for off season the value is unbeatable!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: nice vacation for the money, but...               More photos
Reviews.Author: markgasmo

Reviews.Content: I will never recommend it  -3 days without hot water-3 days whithout ANY chance to change beach towels (ran out)-glasses always HOT-lack of waiters. No way to get a drink unless you help yourself-service was 4*-fridge in room made drinks just fresh-Air Conditioned worked randomly-2 times staff entered my room without knoking-room towels were just 3 (1 small, 1 medium, 1 large)-Sheets were not changed in 12 nights stay-Sand remained in room as clean up was made in 5-8 minutes-Although my 12 year old daughter paid as an adult, she was not allowed to dine at french restaurant after 8pm-Mexican restaurants has rats. Food is disgusting (pork chops from lunch). -Italian restaurant offers as risotto the rice from breakfast-Japanese restaurant is a joke. More like cheap low budget chinese european rests-Both Italian and Mexican are not real restaurants. They are the beach buffet redecorated daily. No toilets. Have to go to the beach toilets.-buffet is a training place for walking competitions. We were 5 and tables of that size (remember, 5 people means children involved) were at the end of the room, so, I had to walk 2 km daily when having breakfast-No money change at reception. Have to go to a Banco Popular office and queue until we were told they ran out of pesos.-Internet: 4 PCs. Just working 2. Slow. Queue again. Mouse was dirty. I personally cleaned it. But still was dirty, so, I had to spend 3 times the time to do anything compared with any normal PC. 3鈧?for 15 minutes.-The buffet has only 1 toilet, so, it was used and used by many people. Its smell was --- at all times. Something not very nece when you are trying to eat.I stop here but could continue...
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Ok hotel, but very good vacation Location: the Barcelo resort is composed of 4 hotels (Beach, Caribe, Casino, Golf). There is a 5th hotel (Palace) that is off limits. The buildings are small 3 story buildings placed in different locations in the village. You will have to work on your navigation skills on the first few days to get around. There is a bus (in the shape of a train) that goes from one hotel to the next. The gardens are well kept and manicured.Entertainment: there are 2 dance clubs in the village. One (non-Latin) opens at 11pm and the other at midnight (Latin music). The non-Latin club is just a hole in the ground. There is nothing special about this place. The Latin club, I never got to go because it would open too late to bother with. The shows at the different lobbies were ok, nothing great. Tropicalisimo at the Casino hotel was amazing. Make sure you go to it. They say that no cameras are allowed but I saw some people taking pictures at the show and no one said anything then. The rest of the entertainment is pathetic but that is the case for almost every other hotel in the Caribbean. Dance lessons are a joke. I simply don't understand why they don't offer real dance lessons (even at a cost). It is not like the entertainment staff does not have the skills. They are experts in Latin dancing.Beach: Bavaro has natural wave breakers (rocks) so you don't get waves coming to shore. I personally don't like this. You can literally go 50 to 100 meters in and the water is only about a meter deep. Varadero, Cuba has better beaches.Other activities: Great scuba location about 10 minutes from the hotel. Great water visibility, and corals but not a lot of fish. Horse back riding is offered. There is nothing special about it. No training is given on how to ride the horses. The horses tend to speed up without warning and tend to fight among themselves while you鈥檙e riding them. Leave this activity until the end that way you won鈥檛 have bruises and a sore behind for the rest of your vacation.Service: I found the service a little nonchalant. I鈥檝e been in other places like Mexico and Cuba where a lot of emphasis is placed on tipping. Here, it appears that no tipping is expected so you don鈥檛 get good service. I found the staff in general new very little about what is going on in the hotels. It鈥檚 a very large compound, so it is not possible to get to know anyone working there. It is not a friendly place.Food/Drinks: Every hotel in the village has a buffet restaurant. There is a good selection of foods, drinks, and fresh fruits. Bottle water is readily available. There are other restaurants where you can eat during the day. The Grill restaurant is the best, followed by the Italian restaurant. I was not very impressed with the Mexican restaurant. A restaurant called 鈥榣as uvas鈥?is advertised as a seafood restaurant but it has horrible food. Don鈥檛 go there. Just go to the buffet restaurants and get some fresh 鈥楳ero鈥?(a fish) if you want seafood.Rooms: I was not happy with my room. The floor in the washroom and entrance was wet all the time. Other then that, it was a nice room. The wetness and humidity made it prone to fungus growing on the chairs (we never used them) and on anything that was left unattended for a couple of days. We got 2 small bed pushed together. This was not very romantic but it help in assigning one of the beds as the 鈥榮and bed鈥?and the other as the 鈥榮leeping bed鈥? Staff don鈥檛 knock at the door and wait for a response before entering. One time, I had asked for towels since none had been left when they cleaned the room. I was already naked, getting ready to take a shower when the door was opened without warning.Shopping: Expensive. I was in Cancun last year and I was able to buy 10 necklaces for $20. In Punta Cana, they wanted $10 for each. Music CDs at the airport were way too expensive.Suggestions to the hotel: offer real dance lessons; sell fresh coconuts to tourists; lower prices in gift shops (tourists would buy more); open the clubs a little earlier (10 pm); develop some real clubs; put more alcohol in the drinksSuggestions to tourists: there is not much you can buy at the airport, so make sure you buy everything before you leave; most of the action happens in the Beach resort
Reviews.Author: ecmelara

Reviews.Content: Wow what a Great place to have Fun       Beach 1
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Best vacation spot ever!!! In one week I am on my way back to this resort for the second time (it is worth visiting more than once) and i can't wait!! First of all, the beach and the gardens are beautiful. The beach is always clean, the sand is fluffy and white and the water is clear and warm with very little seaweed. There are always staff members looking after the gardens and they look great. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. They don't speak much english (and i don't speak much spanish) but they tried hard to understand and get whatever you wanted. Many of the staff members do speak french, so if you can remember what you learned in school that helps a lot. We were told ahead of time not to tip because tips are already included, and no-one seemed to have a problem with this. We did leave little gifts like candy in the hotels rooms for the cleaning ladies and they seemed to appreciate them. The rooms were very clean, we did not have problems with bugs or anything like that. They aren't the nicest looking rooms, but it makes you appreciate the beauty of the rest of the resort more. The food was amazing!! I love all types of food and really enjoy a good meal, and i have no complaints. There is something for everyone... you can even have take-out pizza on the beach and get hamburgers and hotdogs by the pool if you can't survive without american food for a week. This really was the best vacation ever, we always found fun things to do, and if you are there to do nothing for a week or two, it's even better. None of us were sick last time, however as a precaution we are bring some medicine this time just in case. If you go with a great attitude and relax and have fun, you'll love this place!! If not, don't sit next to me on the beach while i'm enjoying my afternoon nap :)
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Don't Knock Just come right in We experinced staff who would enter your room without knocking on the door. When they did knock the key must have been in the door, they entered so fast. We had to ask for two days to get a face cloth. The last and final straw was the phones were not working in the rooms. This was the week of January 21, 2005.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel My family stay there for a week. My twin fourteen year olds loved it. They gave us two rooms and were cleaned and the refrigirators were restocked everyday. We loved the food, especially the steak-house. The staff were friendly and willing to help. The only thing that we don't recommend is horseback riding. The trip was supposed to be two hours,but with all the planning and everything else, it came out to be less than an hour and the horses were all underfed. We finished very tired, trying to make them move. Everybody was complaining about it. This is the only thing we definatly dont like. The rest was great. The beach was one of the greatest beaches. The water was clear and the temperature was great. We had such a wonderful time that we are planning to go back again this year. You will never regret going there.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Worse Food--We All Got So Sick I spent a week there with my boyfriend. I will break up my opinions into sections and rate each section accordingly. Grounds: I give this area a five star. It was the most beautiful place and very clean. The resort grounds were absolutely beautiful! The pools were clean, the gardens were exceptionally well maintained. The beach was perfect. There was a little train which took you to the other resorts which were only minutes away. You could hop on and off the train which came every few minutes. Room: I did find one cockroach in my room one day but I have to say I am a VERY fussy housekeeper and I did find the grounds and the room to be well kept and clean. Our refrigerator was restocked daily with pop and water. The room, by Canadian standards, would probably be rated a three star. The shower worked well and the water was hot. We did spend a fair bit of time in out room after the first couple of days as we kept getting sick.Drinks: A three star. The quality of the drinks depended on where you went. I would recommend the bar at the casino. The poolside bars were okay. We are rather quiet people but friendly and polite. We tipped well at all times. Despite our efforts to show our appreciation, the majority of the staff was unfriendly. I didn't see a single staff member smile the whole time. Expect to wait at the bar for a while if you are a male and not tipping well. I watched one bartender serve many people despite others being there first. Food: A one/two star. I must admit I am a fairly fussy eater. When vacationing, I like my seafood and nice restaurants. The buffet at the Casino had crows and flies enjoying the food along with the tourist. I had the smoked salmon pasta. I would strongly advise anyone to stay away from any seafood or fish completely. Everyone I talked with got sick from it. Many of the people we met expressed their disapointment in the food. If you stayed at the Paradise, the people who I spoke with said it was good. If you stayed at the Casino, Golf, or Garden, you couldn't eat at the Paradise. I tried all three buffets and some of the restaurants. We, and many other people were frequently ill. I would recommend you have breakfast at the Amber (no crows in the food). The little restaurant at the Garden has a beach view. I survived most of the week on their potato soup as I was nautious and had bouts of sickness throughout the trip. So did the people we were with, and others I had met. It is worth going to the pharamacy they have on site for something stonger than Imo.dium. They don't speak any English but appear to know what you wantShopping: There is no soliciting on the beach at all. If you walk down the beach you will find a mall with much better prices than the boutiques and much better selection. Barter at about half the asking price. They are pushy and will offer you gifts. Golf: my boyfriend is a golfpro. We both enjoyed the driving range and the roosters in the morning made it a different but fun experience. The golf course was okay according to the golf pro. I have travelled a fair bit and in sum, as beautiful as the scenery is, I wouldn't reccomend this resort because of the unfriendly service and the fact that you eat for necessity and not enjoyment and you know that when you do eat, it may make you sick. Refrigeration is a definite problem at this resort. Cold cuts were left out in the heat for long periods of time and usully were not on ice. Because of this experience, I probably wouldn't try another Bavaro.Casino: They play blackjack carribean style. Don't expect to win.
Reviews.Author: emilie2697

Reviews.Content: i had lots of fun!!! I really enjoyed the beach resort, although I have to recommend if planning to meet people and have a good time go between the months of July-August. I was there last weekend and the hotel seemed very quiet and full with couples. If your looking to settle down with your couple Jan-Feb, May-Jun, Oct- Nov would be a good time for you. The disco is very cool.. and so are the employees. I would recommend it to anyone. J.D
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great vacation Excellent. It was our third time visiting this resort and I can't complain about one thing. The beach is awesome, the food was wonderful (something for everyone)and the staff was very helpful. We thought the Mexican restaurant and the Casino buffet by far the best. I will definitely go back again. It just kepts getting better.
Reviews.Author: ladybug2

Reviews.Content: a great vacation! wow!. i just got back home from a long stay at the golf and casino resort. We had such a great time. The food was awesome. Everyone there is friendly and they are always willing to help you in anything. The nightclubs were off the chain. The beach is beautiful. Super clear and clean. A great vacation ill always remeber. If you wanna go party and relax, at the same time, then i recommend you this place.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Beautifical well-kept grounds My boyfriend and I just got back from holidays at the Barcelo Bavaro Casino Resort. My first impression was that the grounds were extremely well kept. There are many beautiful palm trees and lush greens surrounding the area. There was always staff cleaning the grounds and keeping everying looking presentable. There were flamingos at the hotel which were quite interesting to look at. The pool was large and always looked clean. There was plenty of reclining chairs by the pool. The beach is very nice. However, there was lots of seaweeds by the shore line and the sand wasn't as powdery white as I thought it would be. Also make sure to take bug repellent as I got bit like crazy. The hotel was very empty. I was quite surprised by that. The hotel lobby was quite cozy with it's piano bar and many lounge chairs. The pianist played nice tunes after 10pm. Now for the downside of this hotel. The buffet wasn't very good. I found the buffets at the other hotels (Beach, Golf and Gardern) as well as the other a la carte restaurants much more enjoyable. In addition, although our room was large (we received the one bedroom loft suite with 2 bathrooms and 2 televisions), it was in great need of updating and repairs. I honestly did not feel comfortable in this room. The showers hardly had any water pressure, the toilets hardly flushed and although our maid did an average job keeping it clean, the years of wear and tear were definitely noticable. However, I am kind of a clean freak and maybe others wouldn't feel the same way as I do. For the most part, my boyfriend and I hung around the Beach hotel the most (this is where most of the action is). We enjoyed all the a la carte restaurants especially the Steak House. The take out pizza is also very good. The club was nothing special. If your looking for a self contained resort to relax and don't really want to experience the culture then this is the place for you as there really isn't anything nearby. As for me, I wish I had the opportunity to see more of the people and the culture. I would rate everything about this resort 4 stars, however, the rooms itself were around a 2 1/2 - 3 stars. The Dominican people are one of the most friendly and hard working people I have met.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Hate to sound unappreciative, but it was simply OK My husband and I just got home from our stay at the Barcelo Bavaro. The grounds and the beach were simply beautiful. However, our hotel room was in need of a bit of updating. It was small (but who cares). I did care that the bathroom needed some work. At one point, we had water come from out of the already water damaged ceiling. However, it was fixed while we were at dinner... they also left a fruit basket and bottle of rum in apology. The food was good, but just different from American food with smaller portions. I craved cookies and doritos! It was strange to see the topless European women on the beach... though, my husband seemed fine. By the way, we were there about 3 days before we heard anyone speak English. This doesnt seem to be a big vacation spot for Americans. We met only 4 American women all week, but met some lovely Canadians. My suggestions: bring lots of small bills, a washcloth (there were none), Immodium AD, sunscreen, your favorite snacks, and a large travel mug (for less trips to the bar). Hope this helps
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Piece of Paradise.... Just returned from spending March Break 2004 at the Barcelo Beach Resort. When we arrived at the reception desk we were quickly escorted to our rooms which had a full view of the ocean. We mainly ate at the Buffet and there was always an abundance of salads, fresh fruit, delicious fruit drinks, meats, vegetables and desserts. All day long there are drinks available at the bars and pizza, french fries, hot dogs all available at the pool. The highlight was the trip to Isle Saona on the catamaran. I would return just to enjoy that trip again. The beach is powdery sand and is always kept very clean. The staff are a wonderful group of people who are always very courteous and polite. Any enquiries email us at bdpike@rogers.com
Reviews.Author: tahneecanada

Reviews.Content: Fantastic Best beach we have ever been to, lots of selection for food choices and the staff were great. Lots to do and had no problems with towels,chairs etc but we did go off season, (jan16-23),
